comment: Dr. Shope isn't a bad teacher but he isn't supper tech savvy. He will ONLY email you a letter grade, and will not disclose a number grade. Grades are due tomorrow and he still has not posted them on D2L. All in all though, his assignments aren't insanely hard. As long as you're good with not knowing your exact grade he's worth taking. Easy pass.

He is a very sweet, professor and tries to make class fun. Sometimes it is hard to ask him questions because he doesn't understand what you are asking most of the time. If you want an easy class, you should take him, but if you want to learn anything he isn't the best at improving your writing knowledge besides fragments and grammatical errors.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Shope is a kind-hearted older man who is genuinely curious about his students. He wants you to succeed and will work with you through your papers. The only thing I will mention is that sometimes he talks through the class so long that it can be difficult to work on the assignment that is due at the end of the period. Overall, I recommend him!

He's nice as a person but unless you are an amazing writer I don't recommend him. If you do take him go to the writing center so they can proofread for grammar (he's obsessed with it). Attendance is mandatory but we would just kinda sit in class doing not much of anything.
Very sweet guy. His storytimes are always nice and heartwarming. Actually try on our papers because he grades pretty seriously. overall nice class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: I took this class during the coronavirus and unfortunately had to attend his class online. In person I'm sure he is much greater but online he emails you what you have to do for the day and doesn't go into much detail about your assignment. Writing papers has been a struggle because he just gives us textbook pages and Perdue Owl links, that it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: He is like an old teddy bear. He grades the papers thoroughly, but is always available if you need help. Great sense of humor and an overall great person. 10/10 recommend taking his class if you have the chance. Just make sure you show up, try on the four essays youre assigned throughout the semester, and dont slack
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Throughout the semester you will write 4 research papers and that is basically all you do while in class. The final is just another paper written during the class on an unknown topic. He ALWAYS takes attendance and you can't be even a minute late, but he is very understanding about making up assignments due to absences.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: 4 papers 2 APA/MLA and one final in-class paper. 3 "required" textbooks that he uses as a basis for grading his papers. If I got something wrong on a paper, it's because it was mentioned in the book and I didn't follow the book rules. STRICT attendance policy. If you're a minute late, automatically tardy. Tough grader, nice man. Didn't lecture much
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very tough grader!! Also a stickler for attendance. He grades papers like everyone is professional writers. I wrote some of my best papers in this class and he TORE THEM UP. I wouldn't recommend him to anyone, but he does look like Bernie sanders though.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Dr. Shope was a nice professor but i learned absolutely nothing in this class. It was all papers that he harshly graded.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: VERY STRICT ATTENDANCE POLICY. Even if you are two minutes late he counts you tardy and you only have three before he counts it as an absence. Three absences equal a letter grade off. Besides that, great professor. Relatively easy class. Show up and don't flake on the papers and you'll be fine.

Super nice man, & does everything to make sure everyone does well in his class. 4  essays and one final which is an in-class essay. He's an easy grader and spends every class going around the room asking if anyone needs help with their paper. Allows you to miss 6 days-- picky about tardiness though.  Highly recommend him to everyone.

4 essays and the final which is an easy. You can miss 5 days and he will nit pick attendance. He is a really good guy and will help you out whenever you need it. Gives you the whole period to just work on computers. He will come to class late from time to times. Tries to nitpick essays for grammar but thats about it. Good teacher.

4 essays, 1 in class essay for the final. Sometimes his essay instructions aren't very clear, but it's nothing you can't do. 2 MLA and 2 APA style essays. 500 to 1200 words for each essay. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!!! He gives good feedback. He gave me a B-and i argued my way up to an A-. Very understanding, compassionate. "I learn my from my students"
4 essays plus the final is all your grade is. Grades fairly. Easy to get an A if you complete all essays and follow his guidelines. Can only miss 3 days of class.

4 essays is your grade, all in class. Lots of time to complete them. grades fairly. Essays are not long. use APA &  MLA, all sources can be online as long as they are reliable. Sweet professor who wants you to succeed. Can miss 5 days, any more you get a 0 (not his policy all english classes are like this) strongly recommend taking him

Very good teacher. Dr. Shope is very kind and lineate and is always available for help. He does take attendance and the class moves very slowly, but he grades easily and always helps you to improve your writing. He is a respectable old man.
PS: The person who said he doesn't like to give out A's must have never come to class or done an assignment, because he is the easiest grader I've ever encountered.

Hes really nice, funny, and willing to help students, but I just did not like his teaching style. We spent so much time debating ONE point that it took us 3 weeks to do one chapter. Then the other 4 chapters we didnt get to were stuffed into the test with the instructions Just read the summary. Nice, but wouldnt take again.

Dr. Shope is very knowledgeable and very nice! He wants the class to do well, which is why he will surprise you on his exams, which are 90% multiple choice. Overall, great professor; pretty easy if you reread the book and pay attention in class. Exams, especially the final, are doable.

class can be very boring and it is very hard to make an a on the papers but not impossible.  He is very willing to help if you ask and the class is easy.  Time moves very slowly in this class though.  I would recomend this teacher to students who know how to write well.  other than the 3 papers ther is minimal work required.

Hard grader. Doesn't like to give out A's. Takes attendance everyday. Nice guy but takes favoritism to students talking about religion because he is a pastor at a church. Pretty easy material, he just grades too hard. So unless you plan on talking about religion for all your topics don't expect on an A.
Nice teacher but the class is boring and he grades hard. Always takes attendance

The class is easy if you like doing boring work. The class moves S...L...O...W...L...Y. Assignments are generic. Not too much room for creativity. Required Throeau reading, again- boring. Required paper on peotry analysis- mostly limited to old school poetry, no contemporary ANYTHING about class
